comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Contrast this with the couple from Ballyvaughan?  Affluent, well fed, well shod, well dressed, at ease with the camera and the children had a future to look forward to.

comment.author: 12220922@N05
comment._content: The little boy looks animated and cheerful - quite unusual in photographs of this era. Is that a cricket ball he's holding? Maybe he went on to become a world-class cricketer...

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Old children's portrait trick: a busy little guy will at least keep his hands still if you give him a ball to hold.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Whereas the little guy(?) on the cushion looks about ready to peg the stuffed animal at the photographer...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 59941010@N06
comment._content: Very nice, I really like the little boy.

comment.author: 47290943@N03

comment.author: 64478079@N02
comment._content: they look quite a bit older for having children so young

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/resel] Well, Mr Brennan certainly does anyway. I'd imagine Mrs Brennan was quite a bit younger than her husband...

comment.author: 76506865@N03
comment._content: the baby girl look  as if she is scared of the camera man ... :P

comment.author: 94757779@N05
comment._content: This is a photo of my grand parents and uncle & aunt. My grandfather died in 1943 and my grandmother died in the mid 1980's.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/94757779@N05] Hello John! Delighted that you found these photos. Can you tell us names for your grandmother and uncle and aunt? We've only ever known your grandfather's name...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
